references: NatureServe. 2014. NatureServe Explorer: An online encyclopedia of life [web application]. Version 7.1. NatureServe, Arlington, Virginia. Available http://explorer.natureserve.org. (Accessed: February 21, 2014 ).

habitat_description: The Olympic Marmot is restricted to alpine and subalpine mountain slopes on the Olympic Peninsula of Washington (Barash 1989).  Tall sedge communities of mesic grasses and Valeriana are important for the species (Barash 1989), as are subalpine and alpine meadows and talus slopes or scree near the timberline  (NatureServe 2014).  They also inhabit lush subalpine meadows of carex, grasses, lupines, polygonum, erythronium bordered by alpine firs and with krummholz Douglas fir and Western white pine interspersed (Barash 1989).  They occur between 1700 and 2000 m in elevation (NatureServe 2014, Barash 1989). N. M. Tarr, 19March2014.
